td.content: s:a 29 yr old m presents with moderate nausea, moderate vomiting, mild vague postprandial epigastric pain and Cancer. These symptoms are present for about 3 weeks. he drinks at least 4 beers a day Patient does not smoke o:Height 64 in, Weight 171 lbs, Temperature 98.9 F, Pulse 75, SystolicBP 110, DiastolicBP 73, Respiration 15 a:Stomach Cancer p:performed E/M Level 3 (new patient) - Completed, and referred patient to oncology.

td.content: s:white male aged 30 years describes mild vague postprandial epigastric pain, moderate vomiting and moderate nausea. o:Height 63 in, Weight 167 lbs, Temperature 98.1 F, Pulse 66, SystolicBP 106, DiastolicBP 65, Respiration 15 a:Stomach Cancer p:performed E/M Level 2 (established patient) - Completed, and referred patient to oncology.

s:a 30 yr old white male crystallographer presents with 5 weeks history of mild vague postprandial epigastric pain, moderate nausea and moderate vomiting. o:Height 64 in, Weight 172 lbs, Temperature 98.4 F, Pulse 67, SystolicBP 113, DiastolicBP 74, Respiration 17 a:Stomach Cancer p:performed E/M Level 2 (established patient) - Completed, and ordered EGD.

s:30 yo M complains of moderate vomiting for 4 days. NKDA. o:Height 63 in, Weight 165 lbs, Temperature 98 F, Pulse 66, SystolicBP 104, DiastolicBP 63, Respiration 15, EGD shows esophagitis with a massive gastric ulcer extending from the inscura to the pylorus, no active bleeding was noted at the site a:Stomach Cancer p:performed EGD, and performed E/M Level 2 (new patient) - Completed.
